wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
==January==
* '''[[3 January|3]]''' - [[Birthday Toast#Tolkien Society tradition|Birthday Toast]].
* '''[[27 January|27]]''' - Actor [[John Hurt]] dies.
* '''[[30 January|30]]''' - Actor [[Victor Platt]] dies.
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 263]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Mallorn 57]]'' is published.

==February==
* '''[[2 February|2]]''' - ''[[The Hobbit Movie Trilogy Colouring Book]]'' is published.

==March==
* '''[[14 March|14]]''' - [[Bodleian Library]] announce the book ''[[Tolkien: Maker of Middle-earth|Tolkien: The Maker of Middle-earth]]'' to go alongside their forthcoming exhibition.
* '''[[25 March|25]]''' - [[Tolkien Reading Day]]. [[The Tolkien Society]] hosts a storytelling of ''[[Mr. Bliss]]'' at [http://www.storymuseum.org.uk/ The Story Museum], [[Oxford]].
* '''[[28 March|28]]''' - ''[[John Ronald's Dragons: The Story of J.R.R. Tolkien]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 264]]'' is published.

==May==
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 265]]'' is published.

==June==
* '''[[1 June|1]] - ''[[Beren and Lúthien]]'' is published.'''

==July==
* '''[[2 July|2]]''' - [[The Tolkien Society]] Seminar at the Hilton, [[Leeds]].
* '''[[3 July|3]]''' - A [[Lawsuits|lawsuit]] was settled between [[Warner Bros.]] and [[Tolkien Estate]].
* '''[[14 July|14]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien the Esperantist: Before the Arrival of Bilbo Baggins]] is published.
* '''[[21 July|21]]''' - ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: Romanticist and Poet]]'' is published.
* '''[[31 July|31]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online: Mordor]]'' is released online. 
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 266]]'' is published.

==August==
* '''[[10 August|10]]-[[13 August|13]]''' - [[Omentielva|Omentielva Otsea]] - the Seventh International Conference on [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]]'s Invented Languages at [[wikipedia:California State University, East Bay|California State University, East Bay]].
* '''[[31 August|31]]''' - ''[[Tolkien Calendar 2018]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - [[Christopher Tolkien]] resigns from his appointment as director of the [[Tolkien Estate]].

==September==
* '''[[15 September|15]]''' - The revised edition of ''[[Aragorn: J.R.R. Tolkien's Undervalued Hero]]'' is published.
* '''[[21 September|21]]''' - The deluxe boxed set edition of ''[[The History of Middle-earth]]'' is published.
* '''[[21 September|21]] - [[24 September|24]]''' - [[Oxonmoot 2017]] at [http://www.sant.ox.ac.uk St Antony's College].
* '''[[30 September|30]]''' - ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: Romanticist and Poet]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 267]]'' is published.

==October==
* '''[[8 October|8]]''' - ''[[Binding Them All]]'' is published.
* '''[[9 October|9]]''' - Filming began on [[Tolkien (film)|''Tolkien'' (film)]], directed by [[Dome Karukoski]] and written by [[David Gleeson]].
* '''[[10 October|10]]''' - ''[[Middle-earth: Shadow of War]]'' is released.
* '''[[12 October|12]]''' - ''[[Flora of Middle-Earth|Flora of Middle-Earth: Plants of J.R.R. Tolkien's Legendarium]]'' is published.
* '''[[19 October|19]]''' - ''[[Middle-earth: From Script to Screen|Middle-earth: From Script to Screen: Building the World of The Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit]]'' is published.
* '''[[19 October|19]]''' - ''[[The Middle-earth Treasury]]'' is published.
* '''[[24 October|24]]''' - [[Faith Faulconbridge]] dies.
* '''[[26 October|26]]''' - [[Roger Garland]] dies.

==November==
* '''[[2 November|2]]''' - The second edition of ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide]]'' is published.
* '''[[13 November|13]]''' - [[Amazon.com Incorporated|Amazon]] acquires the global television rights for the books [[The Lord of the Rings]] and [[The Hobbit]] from [[Tolkien Estate]].
* '''[[30 November|30]]''' - ''[[The Sweet and the Bitter|The Sweet and the Bitter: Death and Dying in J. R. R. Tolkien's the Lord of the Rings]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 268]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Mallorn 58]]'' is published.

==December==
* '''[[1 December|1]]''' - ''[[Death and Immortality in Middle-earth]]'' is published.
* '''[[17 December|17]]''' - ''[[There Would Always Be a Fairy Tale|"There Would Always Be a Fairy Tale": Essays on Tolkien's Middle-earth]]'' is published.
* '''[[22 December|22]]''' - ''[[The Inklings and King Arthur]]'' is published
* '''?''' - ''[[The Flame Imperishable: Tolkien, St. Thomas, and the Metaphysics of Faerie]]'' is published.
